Text.Value: Any chance of a reward?
All right. Come on over here. But fair warning - you might find this hard to believe.

EditorData.NodeContext: allowing us to come closer - she's going to tell us her story and it's intense

Text.Value: Ha. Even if you take me, I'll see you in hell one day. And I'll rip your godsdamned spine out.

EditorData.NodeContext: short, performative and dismissive 'ha'. Then threatening and relishing the chance to fight us

Text.Value: Sorry - I left all my soul coins in hell.

EditorData.NodeContext: sarcastic - soul coins are the currency of hell

Text.Value: They don't need to catch you - I already did. You're finished.
And what is it doing to me exactly? I barely felt a wriggle from it 'til you came along.

EditorData.NodeContext: talking about the parasite - she's not concerned about it, more curious

Text.Value: They're not the kind of people you can run from. I need them dead.

EditorData.NodeContext: dismissing a suggestion to run

Text.Value: I'd come with you just to see them bleed, but I'm too busy bleeding myself. I'll be here when you're done.

EditorData.NodeContext: gestures at the wound in her side (same one she was clutching earlier) on 'too busy bleeding myself'. She's fairly casual about how much she's bleeding

Text.Value: But I won't forget what you did, and I hope I can pay you back down the line.

EditorData.NodeContext: gratitude

Text.Value: Awful lot of people do deserve it though, don't you find?

EditorData.NodeContext: thoughtful - she's talking about people who deserve to be killed

Text.Value: I could use the company, but until I've shaken Zariel off my back, I'd only put a target on yours.

EditorData.NodeContext: regretting turning down our offer to join our party - but convinced it's for our own good

Text.Value: A gang of cultists cornered me in an abandoned tollhouse, not far from here.

EditorData.NodeContext: explaining her situation

Text.Value: I'm good at reading people - there's a knack to it -  and I'm only getting one word from you.

EditorData.NodeContext: appraising us, unimpressed - the one word, in her next line, is 'horseshit'

Text.Value: I met the others who were sent for you - told them I'd help.
If I do this, what do I get in return?
Oh, I have. The kind of battles a cub like you sees in their nightmares.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'cub' as a minor insult about our combat experience - trying to intimidate us a little. Enjoying it

Text.Value: Truth's not quite so exciting. Come on over and I'll tell you the whole story.

EditorData.NodeContext: friendly, gesturing for us to come closer - we're still across the river at this point.

Text.Value: Why don't you just run?
I don't work for her anymore so I'm back to relying on muscle and steel - I'll be just fine.

EditorData.NodeContext: "I'll be just fine" with a smile. She's tough and she knows it.

Text.Value: Take your time - it's only my soul on the line.
I'm a fugitive. I escaped the Hells, and the bastards who were holding me there are trying to take me back.

EditorData.NodeContext: an incredible story delivered as if it's everyday life

Text.Value: Shifty fucker like you doesn't get a second warning, so no sudden movements.
Given how soft you look, I figure you spit fire and crap lightning, so no sudden movements.
Haven't tangled with a gith before, but I hear you're tough. And disciplined. So let's make this quick.
No sudden movements, or you're dead.

EditorData.NodeContext: Projecting authority

Text.Value: Devils don't like to lose their assets.

EditorData.NodeContext: doomed resignation - here's her central problem - she's the 'asset' in this case

Text.Value: I didn't do it on purpose.
I know - they offered a fine reward for your head. I intend to claim it.
I'll knock your teeth down your throat if you keep playing games - this is serious. What was that?

EditorData.NodeContext: threatening, but still curious, especially on last phrase

Text.Value: You gave me some breathing room when you killed those imp-fuckers, but more will come.

EditorData.NodeContext: grateful - the 'imp-fuckers' are cultists

Text.Value: Fight your own battles.
Zariel. Fallen lady, defiled celestial... ruler of Avernus. I was her prisoner, and her champion.

EditorData.NodeContext: Building up to the reveal on 'ruler of Avernus'. She's describing an archdevil - it's a big deal. Zariel (ZAR-ee-el)

Text.Value: You can try.

EditorData.NodeContext: we just threatened to kill her and she's relishing the fight - convinced she'll kick our asses
EditorData.logicalname: Answer: I'll Kill You To Exit

Text.Value: You said yourself, devils are tricksters. I don't believe a word of this.
You looking for me?

EditorData.NodeContext: Almost like 'bring it on' - she's expecting a fight

Text.Value: Her words are spoken in the infernal tongue of devils. A threat, or a plea: 'I don't belong to you'.
Leave.

EditorData.stateContext: Player and karlach on same side of river

Text.Value: Oh, I'm counting on it. I'll be ready for her.

EditorData.NodeContext: grim determination

Text.Value: Ster'ca. What was that? You were inside my head...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: she's startled, angry - her eyes flash with fire
EditorData.NodeContext: ster'ca (stir-KA (very harsh KA)) is a curse word in infernal language. She's shocked, a little afraid of us
EditorData.VFXTags: Eyes flash with fire, probably a material swap to Zevlor's eyes

Text.Value: I boarded in Avernus - that ship was my way out.

EditorData.NodeContext: simple explanation of fantastical event - Avernus = hell

EditorData.stateContext: Karlach is addressing player from across river

Text.Value: *Her mind touches yours - gratitude, warmth, and relief.*
Oh. Sorry I told you to piss off just now. Come on over here - we should talk.

EditorData.NodeContext: surprise on 'oh' - and then smilling as she apologises

Text.Value: Not many did.
If you'd seen as much of hell as I have, you'd rather have a flayer's tentacles up your arse than stay.

EditorData.NodeContext: making a serious point, but drily amused

Text.Value: The people hunting you are. I took care of it.
Safety in numbers? Not a bad idea.

EditorData.NodeContext: considering joining us

Text.Value: I'm in a tight spot - might not be able to get out of it alone.

EditorData.NodeContext: annoyed she has to admit this - she's used to being self-dependent

Text.Value: Hold on - the people I spoke to were paladins, not devils.
I have no idea who you are.
Piss off, you little vulture. I'm not dead yet.

EditorData.NodeContext: annoyed

Text.Value: I haven't survived her yet. She'll come for me - and I'll need to be ready.

EditorData.NodeContext: making it clear her battle isn't over, grimly determined

Text.Value: What makes you so important to them?
What? You've never seen a tiefling before?
Are you demented? I'm a tiefling - same as you. More or less.

EditorData.NodeContext: astonished by how dense we are (on the 'are you demented' variation, she's gesturing toward her horns (she's missing one) when she says more or less)

EditorData.logicalname: Alias (Cinematic - player approaches or fade to close scene)

Text.Value: You get a friend who spat in Baphomet's eye and lived to tell the tale.

EditorData.NodeContext: cocky, with a big grin - Baphomet (Baff-oh-met)

Text.Value: You just happened to stumble across me, here in the arse-end of nowhere? Bullshit.

EditorData.NodeContext: doesn't believe a word of it

Text.Value: That was the least of what I can do.
I didn't think anyone else had survived.

EditorData.NodeContext: amazed and a slight touch of guilt - if she'd known there were survivors she might have stuck around to help

Text.Value: Judging by the wound, I'm guessing they already found you.
Don't sweat it - devils are tricky fuckers. They can't breathe without lying.

EditorData.NodeContext: casually forgiving us for believing lies about her - she's very casual about devils

Text.Value: She tried to break me.

EditorData.NodeContext: defiant

Text.Value: They're not breathing anymore - I killed them.
And the first step is to go home - to Baldur's Gate. I've got a score to settle.

EditorData.NodeContext: continuing with the determination - she's going to kick someone's ass

Text.Value: You shouldn't be sorry - I'm going to kill you as well.
I visited Avernus recently - seemed delightful.
I'm a fugitive - escaped from the Hells, and those bastards are trying to take me back.

EditorData.NodeContext: an incredible story delivered as if it's everyday life

Text.Value: And I'll be going straight back if those imp-fuckers catch me.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'straight back' to hell. said with concern. the 'imp-fuckers' are cultists

Text.Value: Yes.
And I'm none of yours. So piss off.

EditorData.NodeContext: responding 'none of your damn business' - very aggressive on final phrase

Text.Value: I just want to know what's going on here, I swear.
*Then you're lost in visions of demonic armies, as you tear through a landscape of fire and blood.*
You've got my attention - what's your story?
I reckon you've been sold a crock of shit about me.

EditorData.NodeContext: starting to realise she might be able to trust us

Text.Value: Yes I am - the people who are hunting you sent me.
Yes - you're safe.
The place would have been crawling with cultists if I'd stuck around - and they'd have dragged us all back to Avernus.

EditorData.NodeContext: calmly explaining a bad situation - Avernus = hell

Text.Value: Why the change of heart? Ah, doesn't matter - thank you.

EditorData.NodeContext: suspicious on first phrase, then pleased

Text.Value: We should travel together.
I'll do it.
I was warned you're dangerous - so am I.
Why were you in hell in the first place?
That doesn't sound ideal.
Leave.
I'm not doing it - you're on your own.
Sure they were - and I'm Tiamat's left tit.

EditorData.NodeContext: sarcastic - Tiamat - TYAH-maht / ty mt

Text.Value: Lucky you. It's the devils' tongue - infernal. Good for cursing and counting, not so good for small talk.

EditorData.NodeContext: faint smile on 'lucky you'. Then trying to make a joke about something awful

Text.Value: You're very intense.

EditorData.stateContext: Player has crossed river and is close to Karlach

Text.Value: Fuck this - I'm done being reasonable.

EditorData.stateContext: Player has crossed river and is close to Karlach

Text.Value: All right. Maybe the blood-loss is making me soft, but I'm going to trust you. For now.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: lowers the crossbow, grimacing in pain
EditorData.NodeContext: appraising us, starting to trust us

Text.Value: It wasn't me - it's the parasites from the mind flayer ship. They connected us.

EditorData.logicalname: Pointing crossbow at player - across river
EditorData.stateContext: Holding crossbow with both hands now, pointing it at the player

Text.Value: Either piss off, or show me what you're made of.

EditorData.NodeContext: aggressive

Text.Value: I met the people looking for you - and killed them.
If you keep pointing that thing at me this is going to end badly for you.
Most souls in the Blood War are just meat for the grinder, but not me.

EditorData.NodeContext: proud, grinning, enjoying bigging herself up

EditorData.stateContext: Karlach and player both on same side of river

Text.Value: I'm done listening - I'm ending you.
So you want me to kill the people hunting you?
They cornered me in the tollhouse, just up the hill. Doubt they've gone far after the beating I gave them.

EditorData.NodeContext: explaining the situation, pleased we're helping

Text.Value: I guess they told you I bite the heads off babies, and paint myself in their blood.

EditorData.NodeContext: as if telling an exaggerated story about a boogeyman

Text.Value: Not another word - I'm ending you.
How can I help?
*And smiles as she carves her name across your chest.*
You will be soon - I'm taking your head.
Yes, and I saw hell. You really are a fiend.
What will you do if she sends more?
Do you find this funny?

EditorData.NodeContext: irritated

Text.Value: None of your damn business.
Most souls in Avernus are just meat for the grinder. But not me.

EditorData.NodeContext: proud

Text.Value: Figures. I'll see you in hell one day, arsehole.
Yeah. Can you handle it?

EditorData.NodeContext: serious question

Text.Value: Could have sworn I told you to piss off. Maybe I imagined it.

EditorData.NodeContext: annoyed, dismissive

Text.Value: That was terrifying.
I've never heard that language before.
She thinks she owns you? Who is she?
They said you're a fiend, that you belong in hell.
Leave.
It's not - it's a shitting catastrophe. But at least I'm out.

EditorData.NodeContext: agreeding with our assessment of her situation

EditorData.stateContext: Karlach and player both on same side of river

Text.Value: I held my own. More than. Turns out I've got a knack for killing demons - and I enjoy it. That made me a valuable asset.

EditorData.NodeContext: she's enjoying telling us this - bigging herself up and relishing it

Text.Value: Make 'em scream.

EditorData.NodeContext: with a grin

Text.Value: You get a friend who'll put a dent in the skull of anyone who pisses you off.

EditorData.NodeContext: describing herself - matter of fact and quite friendly

Text.Value: I met the people looking for you. They say you're a killer - a fiend.
Politicians. The fuckers who sent me to hell in the first place.

EditorData.NodeContext: describing her enemies - she really doesn't like them

Text.Value: *And from within, a winged figure steps forward, graceful and terrible. She places her hand on your cheek.*
I'm not getting involved.
Hurt or not, I won't miss - lung, heart, arse or eye. Take your pick.

EditorData.NodeContext: small gestures with the crossbow, aiming at the bodyparts as she calls them out

Text.Value: What do I get in return?
Anyhow. Piss off.

EditorData.NodeContext: shooing gesture

Text.Value: *Then a light, sharper than the truest blade, brighter than a star. It fills you with awe, forcing you to your knees.*
Yeah. Not far from here - gang of cultists cornered me in an abandoned tollhouse.

EditorData.NodeContext: explaining her situation

Text.Value: Kwa'ad vos non petri'kar.

EditorData.NodeContext: gasping, in shock, speaking to the person in her vision rather than to us. Defiant. Infernal language - means 'I don't belong to you'. (Qua-ad voss none pet-ree-kah)

Text.Value: If I help you, what's in it for me?
That ship could have been heading for Sigil or Limbo for all I cared - anything was better than staying.

EditorData.NodeContext: with a shrug, summarising her improvised escape plan Sigil - /sd l/

Text.Value: I was a prisoner, forced to fight in the Blood War - the eternal battle between bad and worse.

EditorData.NodeContext: casually summarising cosmic events as if they're everyday

Text.Value: Back in the Blood War, my commander gave me what I needed to get the job done. I had fire running through my veins.

EditorData.NodeContext: Explaining in a matter of fact way. last sentence is with a smile - remembering it fondly. The fire running through her veins is a reference to having hellish magical abilities

Text.Value: You're picking the wrong side here - those bastards aren't what they claim to be.

EditorData.NodeContext: irritated, but trying to convince us to take her side

Text.Value: Horseshit.

EditorData.NodeContext: dismissive - summarising what we just said in one word - thinks we're liars

Text.Value: I took out a couple, but I need them all dead.

EditorData.NodeContext: deadly serious

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: stands, holding the crossbow in one hand, her other hand pressed to a wound on the left of her stomach. She appraises the player.

Text.Value: Poor bastards.

EditorData.NodeContext: regret

Text.Value: Hm. If you bite as hard as you bark, we might get along. I might even have a job for you.

EditorData.NodeContext: appraising us, starting to trust us

Text.Value: No. You're on your own.
All right, I'm listening - what's really going on here?
You were in hell? So was I, not long ago.
No - not yet.
My advice? Stay away from the city. When I catch up with them, the streets will run red.

EditorData.NodeContext: relishing this - she's heading out on a bloody revenge spree and she's really looking forward to it

Text.Value: Stowing away aboard a mind flayer's nautiloid? Pretty stupid.
It'll turn you into a mind flayer.
*As she winces, agony shoots through you, as if your bodies share the same wound.*

EditorData.NodeContext: She clutches her side, wincing

Text.Value: The paladins you killed were acting on her orders - she'll send more. And worse.
Hold up. One more step, and I put a bolt through your eye.

EditorData.NodeContext: slumped against wall, crossbow on her lap - she raises it wearily and points it at us, then speaks with authority

Text.Value: Maybe I can help - fill me in.
You were expecting the ship?
I'm hunting a fiend - you fit the description.
Now tell me what you just did to me before I make sure you can never do it again.

EditorData.NodeContext: threatening, but curious

Text.Value: Aren't you worried about what the parasite's doing to you?
If you bite as hard as you bark, we might just get along. I'm dangerous all right, but I've got no quarrel with you.

EditorData.NodeContext: appraising us, starting to trust us

Text.Value: They told me you'd slaughtered innocent families.
You're lucky I did.
You must have got clear of the crash site in a hurry.
Hold on a minute - you were on that ship? With the tentacles, and the worms?

EditorData.NodeContext: we just surprised her - first phrase is like 'woah, slow down' energy.

Text.Value: You should travel with me.
Attack.
Did you get the bastards?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: clutches her wounded side as she greets us
EditorData.NodeContext: grimace of pain as she greets us

Text.Value: I don't believe a word of this.
I'm going from one hell straight into another - home, to Baldur's Gate. I've got a score to settle.

EditorData.NodeContext: grim determination

Text.Value: Why are you so important to them?
That's what I thought - it was something inside you. I felt it. One of those godsdamned worms, from the ship.

EditorData.NodeContext: dawning realisation

Text.Value: I know - and I can save their souls by killing you.
Really? You're serious?

EditorData.NodeContext: incredulous

Text.Value: I'm having a very bad day.

EditorData.NodeContext: we just said she was very intense, she's like 'well, yes'

Text.Value: Doesn't seem to have turned you into a mind flayer, unless you've tucked your tentacles down your throat.

EditorData.NodeContext: shrugging - flippant

Text.Value: I'll start worrying when it gives me a reason to.

EditorData.NodeContext: dismissing the issue

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: ~Karlach lowers the crossbow, grimacing in pain

Text.Value: And they need you dead - I'm ending you.
Who are you looking for in the city?
I didn't see you aboard. Where were you?
I don't belong in hell any more than you do. But I was there.

EditorData.NodeContext: matter of fact on first sentence, then preparing to tell us a cool story on the next

Text.Value: My advice? Stay away from the city. When I catch up with the fuckers who did this to me, the streets will run red.

EditorData.NodeContext: relishing this - she's heading out on a bloody revenge spree and she's really looking forward to it

Text.Value: That was one of my good days - the bad ones would knock you sick.

EditorData.NodeContext: drily amused

Text.Value: Hold up - you fought in the Blood War?

EditorData.stateContext: Karlach is addressing player from across river

Text.Value: Hard to believe you're a demon-slayer when you can't deal with a few cultists.
Leave.
No - I just saw a chance and I took it.
ROAR.
If you're not a fiend, what are you?
Somebody fed you a crock of shit, and you swallowed the lot.

EditorData.NodeContext: not judging us - realising she might be able to trust us, we've just been deceived about her

Text.Value: Yeah - with distinction.

EditorData.NodeContext: proud, but making out it's no big deal

Text.Value: My offer still stands - let's travel together.
Fuck yes.

EditorData.NodeContext: punching her fist into her palm and grinning

Text.Value: For now. But... thank you.

EditorData.NodeContext: resignation that her troubles aren't over on 'for now', then gratitude

Text.Value: Tell me what you're doing here. Now.

EditorData.NodeContext: About to loser her temper, but still keeping it for now

Text.Value: HERE TO KILL YOU. SLOWLY.
*The Blood War. You saw it from above as the nautiloid passed through Avernus - this woman was on the frontline.*
Who was that? In your memory?
Leave.
I'll look into it.
What will you do now?
Piss off, or show me what you're made of.

EditorData.NodeContext: aggressive

Text.Value: No, but I see you're hurt - let me help.
Bullshit. I've never killed anyone who didn't deserve it.

EditorData.NodeContext: harsh on bullshit - adamant on rest

Text.Value: If you killed them, I'm guessing you didn't buy their bullshit.

EditorData.NodeContext: pleased

Text.Value: I'm taking your head.
I'll take them down.
I decided to help them instead. I'm taking your head.
Not many people survive an archdevil's fury.
But if you do cut me down - I'll see you in the Hells one day and return the favour. Count on it.

EditorData.NodeContext: we just threatened to kill her and she's relishing the fight - convinced she'll kick our asses

Text.Value: And you believe them? Those bastards are trying to feed you a crock of shit.

EditorData.NodeContext: incredulous

Text.Value: Cute. I've scraped more frightening things than you off my boot.

EditorData.NodeContext: dismissive

Synopsis:
First meeting with Karlach, future Origin/Companion. She's a fugitive, wounded and hiding from cultists who are hunting for her to drag her back to hell.

The dialogue begins with a stream separating the player and Karlach, as she points a crossbow at them when they approach, holding them at bay. 

She's fierce, defiant, and intense. But friendly and grateful if the player helps. Shouldn't be too angry - she's in a bad situation and doesn't know who to trust, but she's also been in far worse situations. She has a sense of humour about her predicatment, no matter how bad it gets.
